position: Associate Account Strategist, Global Customer Services
profiles:
Summary After graduating summa cum laude from the University of Southern California with a B.A. in Communication and Spanish in May of 2014, my love for technology brought me to the beautiful (but foggy) Bay Area.  
 
I began my career in Silicon Valley as a Human Capital Management sales representative at Oracle Corporation, selling recruiting, onboarding, and talent management software to enterprise corporations. Recognized as one of the top-five performers in my 250 person cohort at Oracle's prestigious Sales Academy training program, I went on to serve as a leader on my sales team and meet all lead-generation goals set for me. 
 
Armed with impeccable business communication and sales skills from my time at Oracle, I ventured further into the heart of Silicon Valley to join Google People Operations as a recruiting coordinator in September of 2014. Coordinating all aspects of the Google interview experience for software engineering interns and new graduate hires, I developed incomparable customer-service etiquette. Thriving in the fast-paced, high-volume environment of recruitment at the world's most sought-after employer, I led process improvement projects that influenced recruiting practices nationwide, while maintaining a constant focus on the creation of exceptional candidate experiences for the individuals I supported through the hiring process. 
 
In my current position as an Associate Account Strategist for Global Customer Experience at Google, I am able to utilize the sales, strategic account management and customer service skills honed in my previous roles. Offering trouble-shooting and optimization support for Google Adwords clients, I contribute to the continued success of Google's advertising customers and strive to offer the most meaningful return on advertising investment. 
 
In my free time, you can find me relaxing in San Francisco's parks, baking, traveling, and speaking Spanish! Summary Hi there! My name is Kenneth Hamilton, but my friends and coworkers call me Kenny. I was a 2015 graduate of the University of North Carolina at Chapel Hill. I received a degree in International Business at the Kenan-Flagler Business School with a minor in Philosophy. 
 
I am an avid fan of international travel. Throughout my studies, I have been incredibly fortunate to travel with the Kenan-Flagler Business School to many countries, expand my global knowledge, and interact with students and mentors from across the world. I participated in the March 2013 Global Immersion Elective class that traveled to Abu Dhabi and Dubai in the United Arab Emirates. I am also a participant of Batch 8 of the GLOBE Scholars program, Kenan-Flagler's flagship study abroad program. I, along with 16 other UNC students, studied abroad at the Copenhagen Business School and the Chinese University of Hong Kong during our Junior year. The GLOBE program also entailed study trips to Belgium, Germany, and Indonesia, as well as a number of domestic and international company visits. 
 
My business passions lie within technology, strategy, and global relations. I love working with products and ideas that can change how the world uses technology to accomplish the tasks of everyday life. I am a passionate speaker and writer, and I love working with and getting to know cultures different from my own.  
 
I grew up in Raleigh, North Carolina, and I was a competitive springboard diver on the national level for 10 years. I love cooking and exploring locally-sourced restaurants, and I am an ace on the mean streets of the Mario Kart raceways. Thanks for reading and feel free to contact me! Summary Hi there! CC is known for its unique "block plan," which divides the year into eight academic terms called "blocks." Students study one subject for three and a half week blocks, which advocates say allows for more lab time, for research and study in the field, more intensive learning experiences and fewer distractions. Summary Why Classics and Communications? It's one of the first things I'm asked during an interview and I always give the same answer. I love stories.  
 
It started in the fourth grade when I read my first classical mythology story: the myth of Hades and Persephone. Soon I had read "The Aeneid" by Virgil, then the twelve labors of Hercules, followed by Homer's "The Odyssey."  
 
My interest in Communications arose as an extension of that passion. I want to become more than simply a consumer of stories but a producer of my own content in the communication sphere. 
 
This understanding of the delicate balance between production and consumption of content makes me unique in a vast landscape of graduating students majoring in PR, Strategic Communications, and journalism who go into the PR, HR, and many other business positions. 
 
I use my passion to provide my pitches, events, and programs with their own personalization informed by the stories my clients want to create.It has served me well in my undergraduate career.  
 
And even as you hear my story of why I became a double major in Classics and Communications at Stanford University, I hope it inspires you to want to know more about me and what I can do for your company. Summary I am a 2013 graduate of Northwestern University in Illinois, currently living and working in Ann Arbor, Michigan. I taught English to classes of 40-50 1st-3rd graders and it is easily the most difficult thing I have ever done. I have worked in a mayoral press office, ran a seven day 24 hour fundraiser that generated $40,000, and have achieved a degree of proficiency in one of the most challenging languages available. However, it all pales in comparison to the organizational, communicative, time management, and planning skills required to keep 45 chinese seven year olds interested in English for more than three minutes.
